Adding missions
Y'know, links to chapters about specific missions would be nice.

UKSA - Mission Logs.

Mission 1 KEOCS I.

http://imgur.com/a/BSOqG#0

Mission Objective:

Put a communications satellite in kerbo-synchronous orbit.

Mission Summary:

Mission was a complete success. The Titan I proved to be an effective launch vehicle able to deliver it's payload to kerbo-synchronous orbit with out leaving any debris in space.

Kerbin equatorial orbit communication satellite is operational and working within normal parametres.

Edited December 14, 2013 by BritOpsGaming

UKSA - Mission Logs.

Mission 2 KEOCS II.

http://imgur.com/a/ON8az#0

Mission Objective:

Put a communications satellite booster unit in kerbo-synchronous orbit then rendezvous with KEOCS I and dock.

Mission summary:

After noticing that the standard KEOCS style satellite will not quite cut it for orbital communications, a booster unit was designed to increase the capabilities of the satellite and to make it more efficient.

Mission was a complete success. The Titan I proved to be an effective launch vehicle able to deliver it's payload to kerbo-synchronous orbit and rendezvous with KEOCS one to deliver a communications booster unit. No debris left in orbit. KEOCS communications booster unit docked and working within normal parametres.

Edited December 14, 2013 by BritOpsGaming
Spelling/Grammer

UKSA - Mission Logs.

Mission 3 KEOCS III.

http://imgur.com/a/aN59s#0

Mission Objective:

Put a communications satellite in kerbo-synchronous orbit then separate it form KEOCS I.

Mission summary:

The standard KEOCS design was modified to include the booster unit. Mission was a complete success as the Titan I delivered it's payload into KEO, put KEOCS III roughly 6000km away from KEOCS I and successfully de-orbited leaving no debris in orbit.

Kerbin equatorial orbit communication satellite III is operational and working within normal parametres.

Edited December 14, 2013 by BritOpsGaming

UKSA - Mission Logs.

Mission 4 KEOCS IV.

http://imgur.com/a/ApCYK#0

Mission Objective:

Put a communications satellite in kerbo-synchronous orbit then separate it form KEOCS I and KEOCS III.

Mission summary:

The standard KEOCS design was modified to include the booster unit. Mission was a complete success as the Titan I delivered it's payload into KEO, put KEOCS IV roughly 4000km away from KEOCS I and roughly 6000km from KEOCS III then successfully de-orbited leaving no debris in orbit and even put on a light show for the folks back at the KSC.

Kerbin equatorial orbit communication satellite IV is operational and working within normal parametres. Communications network is complete for now.

Edited December 14, 2013 by BritOpsGaming
Grammer
Thanks. Much better now Congrats on establishing picture perfect constellation of KEO sats.

UKSA - Mission Logs.

Mission 5 Hermes I.

http://imgur.com/a/al3NA#0

Mission Objective:

Put a small radar altimeter equipped satellite in a 90 degree inclined orbit then proceed to scan the planetary surface to make a preliminary height map of the terrain.

Mission summary:

The mission is ongoing but the launch and orbital insertion went mostly to plan however the Titan I drifted to the right as it did it's gravity turn so Hermes I had to use it's monopropellant engines to correct.

Hermes I is fully operational and is working within normal parametres and has began planetary cartography.

UKSA - Mission Logs.

Mission 6 Firefly I.

http://imgur.com/a/oaH77#0

Mission Objective:

Test the Titan II launch vehicle and put a kerbal in space.

Crew:

Danbro Kerman

Mission summary:

The mission was nearly a complete success but the Firefly I orbiter sustained a major engine malfunction so had to de-orbit using the reaction control system and ended up over shooting the targeted landing zone however the new launch vehicle the Titan II worked better than expected and delivered it's payload into LKO and de-orbited leaving no debris.

Edited December 15, 2013 by BritOpsGaming

UKSA - Mission Logs.

Mission 7 Hermes II.

http://imgur.com/a/w8Jpj#0

Mission Objective:

Put a small SAR altimeter and spectrometre equipped satellite in a 90 degree inclined orbit then proceed to scan the planetary surface to make a preliminary height map of the terrain.

Mission summary:

The mission is ongoing but the launch and orbital insertion went mostly to plan however the Titan I drifted to the right as it did it's gravity turn so Hermes II had to use it's mono-propellant engines to correct and then boosted itself into a higher orbit.

Hermes II is fully operational and is working within normal parametres and has began planetary cartography.

Edited December 15, 2013 by BritOpsGaming

UKSA - Mission Logs.

Mission 8 Firefly II.

http://imgur.com/a/58kj4#0

Mission Objective:

Repeat of Firefly one but with a space walk.

Crew:

Mitray Kerman

Mission summary:

The mission was a disaster as the Titan II did not perform well at all as straight after it cleared the launch clamps it pitched over 70 degrees causing the abort to fire. Thankfully no kerbals were lost as the capsule splashed down in the bay near the space centre.
